A company that uses Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management is implementing the Landed cost module.

The company has trade agreements with several vendors to receive discounted shipping costs based on shipping container types.

You need to configure landed costs for the various container types.

Which two features should you configure? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.C: Select the Block removal of approval option for the formula
choices.D: Select the Block editing option only.
choices.A: Require an electronic signature when the formula is approved.
choices.B: Select Block editing and approve the formula.

questions.question_text:
You need to configure production control parameters for liquid cleaning solution manufacturing.
What are two possible ways to achieve this goal? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content: B and C both are correct as per link provided.

First off, option B is not available as there is no setting called 'BOM editing and approve'. There is an option for restricting the BOM editing and there is an option to restrict the approval - 2 separate ones, which present 2 different solutions. To meet the requirements I would go for options A and D.

comments.content:
I've changed my mind: Option B is 2 actions: set Block Edit, and then Approve the formula
So B&C is correct: you can't change or delete approved formulas and you can't unApprove it. At the same time you still can deactivate Approved formula.

If you select Block removal of approval, you can't remove the approval of an approved formula or formula version. However, you can create new formulas and new formula versions, and you can remove the activation of the formula version.

discussion.content: Not sure about C. The requirement is that Approved formulas may be deactivated. This will not be the case if block approval is selected

questions.answer_description: Create, process, and manage production batch orders

discussion.content:
The main characteristics of operations scheduling involve the planning method, the capacity of the resources, and material optimization. The settings that you define allow you to complete the following tasks:

Control the scheduling direction (for example, forward or backward schedule from a date).
Schedule productions based on the capacity of the resources (finite capacity).
Use capabilities in resource requirements in the route.
Schedule resources exclusively.
Schedule productions based on material availability (material optimization).
Schedule subproductions.

comments.content: Job scheduling explodes all operations in the resources into their specific jobs and then date and time-schedules them in the order that the production route specifies.

discussion.content:
The answer provided is correct:
Subcontracting = Job because you always outsource painting and there is no inhouse capacity mentioned according to the requirement.

comments.content:
Final answer.
Plastic = Job because you need to schedule each operation
Assembly = Operation because you can schedule in any order
Subcontracting = Operation because it is an outsource service not requiring operation level scheduling

Plastic = Job because you need to schedule each operation
Assembly = Job because you can schedule in any order
Subcontracting = Job because it is an outsource operation

discussion.content:

Why we need Job for subcontracting?

questions.question_text:
You need to set up the state control for sales of motorcycles.
Which two actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.D: Create an exclusive restricted product list for Missouri and add the motorcycle part to the list.
choices.B: Create an inclusive restricted product list for United States and add the motorcycle part to the list.
choices.C: Create an exclusive restricted product list for California and add the motorcycle part to the list.
choices.A: Create an inclusive restricted product list for United States. Do not add the motorcycle part to the list.

comments.content:
Are you joining? :)

Tip: a product may be added to multiple exclusion lists for the same country/region but for differing states. However, a product may not also exist in an inclusive list for the same country/region.

discussion.content: Should be A and C. Item cannot be added in both lists.

Selected Answer: AC
Should be A C

The correct answer is A and C.
If you add the same item to both the inclusive and exclusive listm you'll get an error when trying to save the restricted product record.
"Only one kind (exclusive or inclusive) of restriction list can exist for a given product & region combination.Select the appropriate list type."
A and C are correct, you need to make inclusive for US and exclusive for California. What is the point to add to both list?
